job_title: Senior Software Engineer, Fixed Income Trading
job_text: ['', 'You view software engineering less as writing code and more as delivering high-value, innovative solutions to real-world problems', 'You strive to make everything around you better', 'Partner with the product and operations teams to gather and understand key requirements, design, and develop system functionality and implement the solutions', 'We provide some of the best perks in the industry, including:', "through innovative technology and product design. Our Company's product ecosystem leverages data and the power of the network effect to create transparency, liquidity and efficient trade execution. Our company's Market Center, the company’s electronic trading platform, connects corporate bond market professionals to a broad network of liquidity and provides a range of trading protocols to access it.", 'Team-oriented and collaborative company culture', 'Here are some personal qualities and skills we’re looking for:', 'Option to work onsite at our New York office or remotely', 'You have experience working directly with corporate bonds or have worked extensively with post- trade processing of other asset classes', 'Lively and dynamic office space with fully stocked kitchen', 'Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage', 'Linux, Docker, Ansible, and AWS for dynamic environments', 'Our Stack:', 'You are passionate about honing your craft inside and outside of work ', 'gRPC and protocol buffers for lightweight, point-to-point service communications', ' Scala with Akka Streams for efficient stream processing', '\xa0', 'Our Company is a financial technology company bringing efficiency, connectivity and access to credit trading', 'Develop tools for handling bond calculations, trade execution, reporting and all other post-trade functions', 'Benefits:', "What You'll Do:", ' Scala with Akka Streams for efficient stream processingKafka for scalable messaginggRPC and protocol buffers for lightweight, point-to-point service communicationsLinux, Docker, Ansible, and AWS for dynamic environmentsGoogle Apps, Slack, and Zoom for open communication and collaboration ', 'Competitive compensationFully paid medical, dental and vision coverageOption to work onsite at our New York office or remotelyLively and dynamic office space with fully stocked kitchenTeam-oriented and collaborative company culture', 'Senior Software Engineer, Fixed Income Trading', 'You strive to make everything around you betterYou are equally excited by experimenting with new technologies as you are about delivering value through maintainable, scalable, and reliable servicesYou view software engineering less as writing code and more as delivering high-value, innovative solutions to real-world problemsYou have experience working directly with corporate bonds or have worked extensively with post- trade processing of other asset classesYou are skilled in concurrency, distributed message-based systems, and have a deep affinity for building reliable, high-throughput, lower latency solutionsYou can clearly communicate your ideas and give and accept direct feedbackYou are passionate about honing your craft inside and outside of work ', 'Competitive compensation', 'We are seeking an engineer to join our Platform team and focus on developing our post-trade processing. The ideal candidate will have prior experience working with corporate bonds or with post-trade processing of other asset classes. You will work closely with other developers, the product team and our operation partners to help define post-trade solutions to use both internally and for clients.', 'Design and develop a next generation system for post-trade processing and automation of treasury execution', 'This is a unique opportunity to be an integral part of our technology team. We take a leading-edge approach to everything we do - from our tech stack to our remote working style - we want our employees to succeed. Our institutional credit trading platform allows for continued innovation andfollows a microservices architecture with multiple Electron-based frontend applications.', 'Design and develop a next generation system for post-trade processing and automation of treasury executionPartner with the product and operations teams to gather and understand key requirements, design, and develop system functionality and implement the solutionsDevelop tools for handling bond calculations, trade execution, reporting and all other post-trade functions', 'Google Apps, Slack, and Zoom for open communication and collaboration ', 'You are skilled in concurrency, distributed message-based systems, and have a deep affinity for building reliable, high-throughput, lower latency solutions', 'You can clearly communicate your ideas and give and accept direct feedback', 'You are equally excited by experimenting with new technologies as you are about delivering value through maintainable, scalable, and reliable services', 'Kafka for scalable messaging', 'About the Role:']

job_title: Senior Software Engineer, Fixed Income Trading
job_text: ['', 'You view software engineering less as writing code and more as delivering high-value, innovative solutions to real-world problems', 'You strive to make everything around you better', 'Partner with the product and operations teams to gather and understand key requirements, design, and develop system functionality and implement the solutions', 'We provide some of the best perks in the industry, including:', "through innovative technology and product design. Our Company's product ecosystem leverages data and the power of the network effect to create transparency, liquidity and efficient trade execution. Our company's Market Center, the company’s electronic trading platform, connects corporate bond market professionals to a broad network of liquidity and provides a range of trading protocols to access it.", 'Team-oriented and collaborative company culture', 'Here are some personal qualities and skills we’re looking for:', 'Option to work onsite at our New York office or remotely', 'You have experience working directly with corporate bonds or have worked extensively with post- trade processing of other asset classes', 'Lively and dynamic office space with fully stocked kitchen', 'Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage', 'Linux, Docker, Ansible, and AWS for dynamic environments', 'Our Stack:', 'You are passionate about honing your craft inside and outside of work ', 'gRPC and protocol buffers for lightweight, point-to-point service communications', ' Scala with Akka Streams for efficient stream processing', '\xa0', 'Our Company is a financial technology company bringing efficiency, connectivity and access to credit trading', 'Develop tools for handling bond calculations, trade execution, reporting and all other post-trade functions', 'Benefits:', "What You'll Do:", ' Scala with Akka Streams for efficient stream processingKafka for scalable messaginggRPC and protocol buffers for lightweight, point-to-point service communicationsLinux, Docker, Ansible, and AWS for dynamic environmentsGoogle Apps, Slack, and Zoom for open communication and collaboration ', 'Competitive compensationFully paid medical, dental and vision coverageOption to work onsite at our New York office or remotelyLively and dynamic office space with fully stocked kitchenTeam-oriented and collaborative company culture', 'Senior Software Engineer, Fixed Income Trading', 'You strive to make everything around you betterYou are equally excited by experimenting with new technologies as you are about delivering value through maintainable, scalable, and reliable servicesYou view software engineering less as writing code and more as delivering high-value, innovative solutions to real-world problemsYou have experience working directly with corporate bonds or have worked extensively with post- trade processing of other asset classesYou are skilled in concurrency, distributed message-based systems, and have a deep affinity for building reliable, high-throughput, lower latency solutionsYou can clearly communicate your ideas and give and accept direct feedbackYou are passionate about honing your craft inside and outside of work ', 'Competitive compensation', 'We are seeking an engineer to join our Platform team and focus on developing our post-trade processing. The ideal candidate will have prior experience working with corporate bonds or with post-trade processing of other asset classes. You will work closely with other developers, the product team and our operation partners to help define post-trade solutions to use both internally and for clients.', 'Design and develop a next generation system for post-trade processing and automation of treasury execution', 'This is a unique opportunity to be an integral part of our technology team. We take a leading-edge approach to everything we do - from our tech stack to our remote working style - we want our employees to succeed. Our institutional credit trading platform allows for continued innovation andfollows a microservices architecture with multiple Electron-based frontend applications.', 'Design and develop a next generation system for post-trade processing and automation of treasury executionPartner with the product and operations teams to gather and understand key requirements, design, and develop system functionality and implement the solutionsDevelop tools for handling bond calculations, trade execution, reporting and all other post-trade functions', 'Google Apps, Slack, and Zoom for open communication and collaboration ', 'You are skilled in concurrency, distributed message-based systems, and have a deep affinity for building reliable, high-throughput, lower latency solutions', 'You can clearly communicate your ideas and give and accept direct feedback', 'You are equally excited by experimenting with new technologies as you are about delivering value through maintainable, scalable, and reliable services', 'Kafka for scalable messaging', 'About the Role:']

job_title: Senior Software Engineer - Player Platform, Riot SDK
job_text: ['', 'Console, Mobile and PC development environments', 'Experience shipping multiple games to at least one of the following platforms: XBox One, PS4, Nintendo Switch', 'Significant hands-on experience with two or more of the following programming languages: C/C++, Java, C#, Objective-C/Swift.', '7+ years of experience in a software engineering role (i.e. software, systems, architecture)', 'Responsibilities', 'Be an individual contributor on the team, where appropriate building reference implementations, tackling challenging and ambiguous technical solutions, and conducting design and coding reviews', 'Establish strong connections with engineers on the team, providing engineers with guidance, mentorship, and support', "It's our policy to provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and members of Riot Games, Inc. Riot Games makes reasonable accommodations for handicapped and disabled Rioters and does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, handicap, veteran status, marital status, criminal history, or any other category protected by applicable federal and state law, including the City of Los Angeles' Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance relating to an applicant's criminal history (LAMC 189.00).", ' Console, Mobile and PC development environments Game engine middleware such as Unity 3D, Unreal Engine and internal Riot game engines 1st party and 3rd party technologies and SDKs  ', 'Game engine middleware such as Unity 3D, Unreal Engine and internal Riot game engines', 'BS in Computer Science or equivalent years of job experience across software', ' BS in Computer Science or equivalent years of job experience across software 7+ years of experience in a software engineering role (i.e. software, systems, architecture) Experience shipping multiple games to at least one of the following platforms: XBox One, PS4, Nintendo Switch Significant hands-on experience with two or more of the following programming languages: C/C++, Java, C#, Objective-C/Swift. ', 'Our Perks', ' Experience working with one or more of the following platforms: iOS, Android, Macintosh Experience working with Unity 3D or Unreal Engine Experience defining and delivering technical solutions to technical customers/users ', 'Experience defining and delivering technical solutions to technical customers/users', 'Desired Qualifications', '1st party and 3rd party technologies and SDKs ', 'Experience working with one or more of the following platforms: iOS, Android, Macintosh', 'Experience working with Unity 3D or Unreal Engine', "Lead a process in defining technical outcomes, tools and solutions that create cohesive and natural developer experiences for Riot's game developers", "Work with game team's technical leads in wholly understanding development needs and challenges when working with central technologies at Riot", 'Partner with project leads and quality leads in defining and grooming high-level user stories', 'Contribute to architecture and solutions that support integrations with console platforms', " Contribute to architecture and solutions that support integrations with console platforms Partner with project leads and quality leads in defining and grooming high-level user stories Be an individual contributor on the team, where appropriate building reference implementations, tackling challenging and ambiguous technical solutions, and conducting design and coding reviews Lead a process in defining technical outcomes, tools and solutions that create cohesive and natural developer experiences for Riot's game developers Establish strong connections with engineers on the team, providing engineers with guidance, mentorship, and support Work with game team's technical leads in wholly understanding development needs and challenges when working with central technologies at Riot ", 'Senior Software Engineer on the Player Platform SDK', 'Required Qualifications']

job_title: Senior Software Engineer, Fixed Income Trading
job_text: ['', 'You view software engineering less as writing code and more as delivering high-value, innovative solutions to real-world problems', 'You strive to make everything around you better', 'Partner with the product and operations teams to gather and understand key requirements, design, and develop system functionality and implement the solutions', 'We provide some of the best perks in the industry, including:', "through innovative technology and product design. Our Company's product ecosystem leverages data and the power of the network effect to create transparency, liquidity and efficient trade execution. Our company's Market Center, the company’s electronic trading platform, connects corporate bond market professionals to a broad network of liquidity and provides a range of trading protocols to access it.", 'Team-oriented and collaborative company culture', 'Here are some personal qualities and skills we’re looking for:', 'Option to work onsite at our New York office or remotely', 'You have experience working directly with corporate bonds or have worked extensively with post- trade processing of other asset classes', 'Lively and dynamic office space with fully stocked kitchen', 'Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage', 'Linux, Docker, Ansible, and AWS for dynamic environments', 'Our Stack:', 'You are passionate about honing your craft inside and outside of work ', 'gRPC and protocol buffers for lightweight, point-to-point service communications', ' Scala with Akka Streams for efficient stream processing', '\xa0', 'Our Company is a financial technology company bringing efficiency, connectivity and access to credit trading', 'Develop tools for handling bond calculations, trade execution, reporting and all other post-trade functions', 'Benefits:', "What You'll Do:", ' Scala with Akka Streams for efficient stream processingKafka for scalable messaginggRPC and protocol buffers for lightweight, point-to-point service communicationsLinux, Docker, Ansible, and AWS for dynamic environmentsGoogle Apps, Slack, and Zoom for open communication and collaboration ', 'Competitive compensationFully paid medical, dental and vision coverageOption to work onsite at our New York office or remotelyLively and dynamic office space with fully stocked kitchenTeam-oriented and collaborative company culture', 'Senior Software Engineer, Fixed Income Trading', 'You strive to make everything around you betterYou are equally excited by experimenting with new technologies as you are about delivering value through maintainable, scalable, and reliable servicesYou view software engineering less as writing code and more as delivering high-value, innovative solutions to real-world problemsYou have experience working directly with corporate bonds or have worked extensively with post- trade processing of other asset classesYou are skilled in concurrency, distributed message-based systems, and have a deep affinity for building reliable, high-throughput, lower latency solutionsYou can clearly communicate your ideas and give and accept direct feedbackYou are passionate about honing your craft inside and outside of work ', 'Competitive compensation', 'We are seeking an engineer to join our Platform team and focus on developing our post-trade processing. The ideal candidate will have prior experience working with corporate bonds or with post-trade processing of other asset classes. You will work closely with other developers, the product team and our operation partners to help define post-trade solutions to use both internally and for clients.', 'Design and develop a next generation system for post-trade processing and automation of treasury execution', 'This is a unique opportunity to be an integral part of our technology team. We take a leading-edge approach to everything we do - from our tech stack to our remote working style - we want our employees to succeed. Our institutional credit trading platform allows for continued innovation andfollows a microservices architecture with multiple Electron-based frontend applications.', 'Design and develop a next generation system for post-trade processing and automation of treasury executionPartner with the product and operations teams to gather and understand key requirements, design, and develop system functionality and implement the solutionsDevelop tools for handling bond calculations, trade execution, reporting and all other post-trade functions', 'Google Apps, Slack, and Zoom for open communication and collaboration ', 'You are skilled in concurrency, distributed message-based systems, and have a deep affinity for building reliable, high-throughput, lower latency solutions', 'You can clearly communicate your ideas and give and accept direct feedback', 'You are equally excited by experimenting with new technologies as you are about delivering value through maintainable, scalable, and reliable services', 'Kafka for scalable messaging', 'About the Role:']

job_title: Senior Software Engineer - Player Platform, Riot SDK
job_text: ['', 'Console, Mobile and PC development environments', 'Experience shipping multiple games to at least one of the following platforms: XBox One, PS4, Nintendo Switch', 'Significant hands-on experience with two or more of the following programming languages: C/C++, Java, C#, Objective-C/Swift.', '7+ years of experience in a software engineering role (i.e. software, systems, architecture)', 'Responsibilities', 'Be an individual contributor on the team, where appropriate building reference implementations, tackling challenging and ambiguous technical solutions, and conducting design and coding reviews', 'Establish strong connections with engineers on the team, providing engineers with guidance, mentorship, and support', "It's our policy to provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and members of Riot Games, Inc. Riot Games makes reasonable accommodations for handicapped and disabled Rioters and does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, handicap, veteran status, marital status, criminal history, or any other category protected by applicable federal and state law, including the City of Los Angeles' Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance relating to an applicant's criminal history (LAMC 189.00).", ' Console, Mobile and PC development environments Game engine middleware such as Unity 3D, Unreal Engine and internal Riot game engines 1st party and 3rd party technologies and SDKs  ', 'Game engine middleware such as Unity 3D, Unreal Engine and internal Riot game engines', 'BS in Computer Science or equivalent years of job experience across software', ' BS in Computer Science or equivalent years of job experience across software 7+ years of experience in a software engineering role (i.e. software, systems, architecture) Experience shipping multiple games to at least one of the following platforms: XBox One, PS4, Nintendo Switch Significant hands-on experience with two or more of the following programming languages: C/C++, Java, C#, Objective-C/Swift. ', 'Our Perks', ' Experience working with one or more of the following platforms: iOS, Android, Macintosh Experience working with Unity 3D or Unreal Engine Experience defining and delivering technical solutions to technical customers/users ', 'Experience defining and delivering technical solutions to technical customers/users', 'Desired Qualifications', '1st party and 3rd party technologies and SDKs ', 'Experience working with one or more of the following platforms: iOS, Android, Macintosh', 'Experience working with Unity 3D or Unreal Engine', "Lead a process in defining technical outcomes, tools and solutions that create cohesive and natural developer experiences for Riot's game developers", "Work with game team's technical leads in wholly understanding development needs and challenges when working with central technologies at Riot", 'Partner with project leads and quality leads in defining and grooming high-level user stories', 'Contribute to architecture and solutions that support integrations with console platforms', " Contribute to architecture and solutions that support integrations with console platforms Partner with project leads and quality leads in defining and grooming high-level user stories Be an individual contributor on the team, where appropriate building reference implementations, tackling challenging and ambiguous technical solutions, and conducting design and coding reviews Lead a process in defining technical outcomes, tools and solutions that create cohesive and natural developer experiences for Riot's game developers Establish strong connections with engineers on the team, providing engineers with guidance, mentorship, and support Work with game team's technical leads in wholly understanding development needs and challenges when working with central technologies at Riot ", 'Senior Software Engineer on the Player Platform SDK', 'Required Qualifications']

job_title: Senior Software Engineer, Fixed Income Trading
job_text: ['', 'You view software engineering less as writing code and more as delivering high-value, innovative solutions to real-world problems', 'You strive to make everything around you better', 'Partner with the product and operations teams to gather and understand key requirements, design, and develop system functionality and implement the solutions', 'We provide some of the best perks in the industry, including:', "through innovative technology and product design. Our Company's product ecosystem leverages data and the power of the network effect to create transparency, liquidity and efficient trade execution. Our company's Market Center, the company’s electronic trading platform, connects corporate bond market professionals to a broad network of liquidity and provides a range of trading protocols to access it.", 'Team-oriented and collaborative company culture', 'Here are some personal qualities and skills we’re looking for:', 'Option to work onsite at our New York office or remotely', 'You have experience working directly with corporate bonds or have worked extensively with post- trade processing of other asset classes', 'Lively and dynamic office space with fully stocked kitchen', 'Fully efficiency, connectivity and access to credit trading', 'Develop tools for handling bond calculations, trade execution, reporting and all other post-trade functions', 'Benefits:', "What You'll Do:", ' post- trade processing of other asset classesYou are skilled in concurrency, distributed message-based systems, and have a deep affinity for building reliable, high-throughput, lower latency solutionsYou can clearly communicate your ideas and give and accept direct feedbackYou are passionate about honing your craft inside and outside of work ', 'Competitive compensation', 'We are seeking an engineer to join our Platform team and focus on developing our post-trade processing. The ideal candidate will have prior experience working with corporate bonds or with post-trade processing of other asset classes. You will work closely with other developers, the product team and our operation partners to help define post-trade solutions to use both internally and for clients.', 'Design and develop a next generation system for post-trade processing and automation of treasury execution', 'This is a unique opportunity to be an integral part of our technology team. job_title: Senior Software Engineer, Fixed Income Trading
job_text: ['', 'You view software engineering less as writing code and more as delivering high-value, innovative solutions to real-world problems', 'You strive to make everything around you better', 'Partner with the product and operations teams to gather and understand key requirements, design, and develop system functionality and implement the solutions', 'We provide some of the best perks in the industry, including:', "through innovative technology and product design. Our Company's product ecosystem leverages data and the power of the network effect to create transparency, liquidity and efficient trade execution. Our company's Market Center, the company’s electronic trading platform, connects corporate bond market professionals to a broad network of liquidity and provides a range of trading protocols to access it.", 'Team-oriented and collaborative company culture', 'Here are some personal qualities and skills we’re looking for:', 'Option to work onsite at our New York office or remotely', 'You have an engineer to join our Platform team and focus on developing our post-trade processing. You will work closely with other developers, the product team and our operation partners to help define post-trade solutions to use both internally and for clients.', 'Design and develop a next generation system for post-trade processing and automation of treasury execution', 'This is a unique opportunity to be an integral part of our technology team. ['', 'Princeton, NJ', 'Programming - SQL and Python proficiency are desirable. An excellent candidate would have demonstrated experience in this area.', 'Intellectual Curiosity - Enjoy tackling challenging problems and developing and honing the necessary skills to do so.Attention to Detail - Demonstrate a problem-solving approach which entails detecting subtle changes which are exhaustively explored until the root cause is determined and nuances are understood.Programming - SQL and Python proficiency are desirable. An excellent candidate would have demonstrated experience in this area.Visualization - Tableau (or similar) proficiency is desirable.\xa0At the very least, candidates must demonstrate an aptitude and desire to learn.Vendor Interaction - Ability to work with external entities to solve problems and understand data.Communication - Effectively communicate ideas and conclusions from analysis through written communication and in group presentations.', 'Data Analyst / Data Engineer / Data Quality', 'Attention to Detail - Demonstrate a problem-solving approach which entails detecting subtle changes which are exhaustively explored until the root cause is determined and nuances are understood.', 'Intellectual Curiosity - Enjoy tackling challenging problems and developing and honing the necessary skills to do so.', 'The volume and breadth of available data has exploded in recent years, making the role fast-paced, dynamic and imperative to our success.\xa0Our analysts work closely with quantitative researchers and data engineers to incorporate data insights into our strategies.\xa0Analysts are expected to analyze large datasets for quality, consistency and potential value by writing simple code and utilizing visualization tools. Additionally, we rely on analysts’ judgment to confirm the accuracy and utility of data by cross-referencing information across a variety of independent sources.\xa0', 'Successful candidates will demonstrate a methodical and rigorous approach as well as a creative and flexible mindset.\xa0The following attributes and skill-sets are desirable:', 'Vendor Interaction - Ability to work with external entities to solve problems and understand data.', 'Visualization - Tableau (or similar) proficiency is desirable.\xa0At the very least, candidates must demonstrate an aptitude and desire to learn.', 'Data is a critical part of our business and influences every aspect of the work that we do. To help our team gain deeper insights and unlock hidden value within our data, we are searching for a talented analyst with a passion for solving challenging, open-ended problems and discovering subtle, intricate details.', 'Communication - Effectively communicate ideas and conclusions from analysis through written communication and in group presentations.']

Flexible Schedule Vacation/PTO  Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision)', ' Salary ', ' Location ', ' Level ', 'REMOTE Data Engineer (Python, Django, Pandas)', 'A Bit About Us', ' Working knowledge or experience in the health, wellness, or preventative medicine industry (strongly preferred)  Experience working with pythons library Pandas (preferred)', ' Flexible Schedule', ' Background working with backend language Python and framework Django', ' Huge opportunity for career advancement!', ' Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision)', ' Title ', ' Strong in Data Analytics with experience working with raw data sets', ' Competitive compensation package!', 'Why join us?', 'Job Details', ' Knowledge of PostgreSQL', ' 3+ years of Data Engineering experience Background working with backend language Python and framework Django Experience working with Machine Learning (ML) or Artificial Intelligence (AI) Knowledge of PostgreSQL Strong in Data Analytics with experience working with raw data sets', ' 3+ years of Data Engineering experience', ' Experience working with Machine Learning (ML) or Artificial Intelligence (AI)', ' Vacation/PTO ', ' Experience working with pythons library Pandas (preferred)']

['', 'Practical experience with data modeling (e.g. dimensional modeling, temporal modeling, OLAP)', 'Basic Qualifications', "What you'll do:", 'Senior Data Engineer', 'Deep knowledge of at least one programming language ecosystem (e.g. Python, Scala, Go) ', 'What we’re looking for:', 'Preferred Qualifications', 'Keep reading if:', ' ', 'Deep knowledge of at least one programming language ecosystem (e.g. Python, Scala, Go) Practical experience with data modeling (e.g. dimensional modeling, temporal modeling, OLAP)', "At our company, we’re building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, our company is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.Senior Data EngineerCommercial Launchpad helps push the Commercial Bank forward by incubating new ideas and accelerating strategic initiatives. We are a diverse, balanced and fearless team of designers, product managers, data scientists, engineers & strategists — working together to solve complex problems across the Commercial Bank. We move fast, we have the freedom to take risks, both in the ways we approach problems and the tools we use.Keep reading if:You embrace change and innovation, always seeking to push the boundaries, are comfortable with challenging the status-quo, and thrive in ambiguity.You LOVE technology and learning new things.What we’re looking for:Amazing technical instincts. You know how to evaluate and choose the right technology and approach for the job. You have stories you could share about what problem you thought you were solving at first, but through testing and iteration, came to solve a much bigger and better problem that resulted in positive outcomes all-around.A love for learning. Technology is continually evolving around us, and you want to keep up to date to ensure we are using the right tech at the right time.Confidence, not ego. You have an ability to collaborate with others and see all sides of the coin to come to the best solution for everyone.Demonstrated experience in the open source, big data ecosystem.What you'll do:As the data engineering technical lead within Launchpad, you’ll be working collaboratively with some of our brightest engineering talent to solve challenging, high impact business problems using data. You will be evaluating, installing, configuring, and deploying software; you will be writing code and use thoughtful engineering practices to test it, deploy it, and run it. We are a part of a larger organization, so we will rely on your ability to get things done through others.All of our infrastructure runs on AWS. Currently we use Airflow, PySpark, NiFi, Kafka, Flink for stream processing. We store data in Parquet and use databases such as Cassandra, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Redshift and Snowflake. We do analytics using H2O, Spark and MLlib, Databricks/EMR, TensorFlow. We build awesome products for our users that use this data. We write microservices in Go and Node.js, orchestrated by Kubernetes, with user experiences written in React and TypeScript. Your hands-on expertise in at least some of these tools will be valuable, as well as your track record of providing effective technical guidance.Basic QualificationsAt least 3 years of experience in software engineering inclusive of source control, agile practices, testing, CI/CD and design principlesAt least 3 years data engineering experience that includes Ingestion, Transformation, Storage, Query, or Analytics open source toolsPreferred Qualifications"]

['', 'Princeton, NJ', 'Programming - SQL and Python proficiency are desirable. An excellent candidate would have demonstrated experience in this area.', 'Intellectual Curiosity - Enjoy tackling challenging problems and developing and honing the necessary skills to do so.Attention to Detail - Demonstrate a problem-solving approach which entails detecting subtle changes which are exhaustively explored until the root cause is determined and nuances are understood.Programming - SQL and Python proficiency are desirable. An excellent candidate would have demonstrated experience in this area.Visualization - Tableau (or similar) proficiency is desirable.\xa0At the very least, candidates must demonstrate an aptitude and desire to learn.Vendor Interaction - Ability to work with external entities to solve problems and understand data.Communication - Effectively communicate ideas and conclusions from analysis through written communication and in group presentations.', 'Data Analyst / Data Engineer / Data Quality', 'Attention to Detail - Demonstrate a problem-solving approach which entails detecting subtle changes which are exhaustively explored until the root cause is determined and nuances are understood.', 'Intellectual Curiosity - Enjoy tackling challenging problems and developing and honing the necessary skills to do so.', 'The volume and breadth of available data has exploded in recent years, making the role fast-paced, dynamic and imperative to our success.\xa0Our analysts work closely with quantitative researchers and data engineers to incorporate data insights into our strategies.\xa0Analysts are expected to analyze large datasets for quality, consistency and potential value by writing simple code and utilizing visualization tools. Additionally, we rely on analysts’ judgment to confirm the accuracy and utility of data by cross-referencing information across a variety of independent sources.\xa0', 'Successful candidates will demonstrate a methodical and rigorous approach as well as a creative and flexible mindset.\xa0The following attributes and skill-sets are desirable:', 'Vendor Interaction - Ability to work with external entities to solve problems and understand data.', 'Visualization - Tableau (or similar) proficiency is desirable.\xa0At the very least, candidates must demonstrate an aptitude and desire to learn.', 'Data is a critical part of our business and influences every aspect of the work that we do. To help our team gain deeper insights and unlock hidden value within our data, we are searching for a talented analyst with a passion for solving challenging, open-ended problems and discovering subtle, intricate details.', 'Communication - Effectively communicate ideas and conclusions from analysis through written communication and in group presentations.']

['', 'Practical experience with data modeling (e.g. dimensional modeling, temporal modeling, OLAP)', 'Basic Qualifications', "What you'll do:", 'Senior Data Engineer', 'Deep knowledge of at least one programming language ecosystem (e.g. Python, Scala, Go) ', 'What we’re looking for:', 'Preferred Qualifications', 'Keep reading if:', ' ', 'Deep knowledge of at least one programming language ecosystem (e.g. Python, Scala, Go) Practical experience with data modeling (e.g. dimensional modeling, temporal modeling, OLAP)', "At our company, we’re building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, our company is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.Senior Data EngineerCommercial Launchpad helps push the Commercial Bank forward by incubating new ideas and accelerating strategic initiatives. We are a diverse, balanced and fearless team of designers, product managers, data scientists, engineers & strategists — working together to solve complex problems across the Commercial Bank. We move fast, we have the freedom to take risks, both in the ways we approach problems and the tools we use.Keep reading if:You embrace change and innovation, always seeking to push the boundaries, are comfortable with challenging the status-quo, and thrive in ambiguity.You LOVE technology and learning new things.What we’re looking for:Amazing technical instincts. You know how to evaluate and choose the right technology and approach for the job. You have stories you could share about what problem you thought you were solving at first, but through testing and iteration, came to solve a much bigger and better problem that resulted in positive outcomes all-around.A love for learning. Technology is continually evolving around us, and you want to keep up to date to ensure we are using the right tech at the right time.Confidence, not ego. You have an ability to collaborate with others and see all sides of the coin to come to the best solution for everyone.Demonstrated experience in the open source, big data ecosystem.What you'll do:As the data engineering technical lead within Launchpad, you’ll be working collaboratively with some of our brightest engineering talent to solve challenging, high impact business problems using data. You will be evaluating, installing, configuring, and deploying software; you will be writing code and use thoughtful engineering practices to test it, deploy it, and run it. We are a part of a larger organization, so we will rely on your ability to get things done through others.All of our infrastructure runs on AWS. Currently we use Airflow, PySpark, NiFi, Kafka, Flink for stream processing. We store data in Parquet and use databases such as Cassandra, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Redshift and Snowflake. We do analytics using H2O, Spark and MLlib, Databricks/EMR, TensorFlow. We build awesome products for our users that use this data. We write microservices in Go and Node.js, orchestrated by Kubernetes, with user experiences written in React and TypeScript. Your hands-on expertise in at least some of these tools will be valuable, as well as your track record of providing effective technical guidance.Basic QualificationsAt least 3 years of experience in software engineering inclusive of source control, agile practices, testing, CI/CD and design principlesAt least 3 years data engineering experience that includes Ingestion, Transformation, Storage, Query, or Analytics open source toolsPreferred Qualifications"]

['', 'Practical experience with data modeling (e.g. dimensional modeling, temporal modeling, OLAP)', 'Basic Qualifications', "What you'll do:", 'Senior Data Engineer', 'Deep knowledge of at least one programming language ecosystem (e.g. Python, Scala, Go) ', 'What we’re looking for:', 'Preferred Qualifications', 'Keep reading if:', ' ', 'Deep knowledge of at least one programming language ecosystem (e.g. Python, Scala, Go) Practical experience with data modeling (e.g. dimensional modeling, temporal modeling, OLAP)', "At our company, we’re building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, our company is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.Senior Data EngineerCommercial Launchpad helps push the Commercial Bank forward by incubating new ideas and accelerating strategic initiatives. We are a diverse, balanced and fearless team of designers, product managers, data scientists, engineers & strategists — working together to solve complex problems across the Commercial Bank. We move fast, we have the freedom to take risks, both in the ways we approach problems and the tools we use.Keep reading if:You embrace change and innovation, always seeking to push the boundaries, are comfortable with challenging the status-quo, and thrive in ambiguity.You LOVE technology and learning new things.What we’re looking for:Amazing technical instincts. You know how to evaluate and choose the right technology and approach for the job. You have stories you could share about what problem you thought you were solving at first, but through testing and iteration, came to solve a much bigger and better problem that resulted in positive outcomes all-around.A love for learning. Technology is continually evolving around us, and you want to keep up to date to ensure we are using the right tech at the right time.Confidence, not ego. You have an ability to collaborate with others and see all sides of the coin to come to the best solution for everyone.Demonstrated experience in the open source, big data ecosystem.What you'll do:As the data engineering technical lead within Launchpad, you’ll be working collaboratively with some of our brightest engineering talent to solve challenging, high impact business problems using data. You will be evaluating, installing, configuring, and deploying software; you will be writing code and use thoughtful engineering practices to test it, deploy it, and run it. We are a part of a larger organization, so we will rely on your ability to get things done through others.All of our infrastructure runs on AWS. Currently we use Airflow, PySpark, NiFi, Kafka, Flink for stream processing. We store data in Parquet and use databases such as Cassandra, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Redshift and Snowflake. We do analytics using H2O, Spark and MLlib, Databricks/EMR, TensorFlow. We build awesome products for our users that use this data. We write microservices in Go and Node.js, orchestrated by Kubernetes, with user experiences written in React and TypeScript. Your hands-on expertise in at least some of these tools will be valuable, as well as your track record of providing effective technical guidance.Basic QualificationsAt least 3 years of experience in software engineering inclusive of source control, agile practices, testing, CI/CD and design principlesAt least 3 years data engineering experience that includes Ingestion, Transformation, Storage, Query, or Analytics open source toolsPreferred Qualifications"]

['', 'The ideal candidate will be a passionate and hands on leader who wants to build the foundations of a world class software organization. We want someone with an innate curiosity who would enjoy getting up to speed on energy quickly in order to approach this sector in a new way. ', ' Preferred Qualifications:', 'MS/PhD in Computer Science or Applied Math ', 'Accountability-minded. Can create a culture of healthy accountability in the team. Can balance code quality and speed to market. Been through a startup before', 'Senior Data/ML Engineer ', 'Participate in the design and implementation of all data science initiatives including ETL/data pipeline building and machine learning/forecasting systems. Build models and programs to predict building demand and onsite energy generation through analysis of data from building management system, weather, and other similar systems to aid in reducing energy consumption. Oversee set up and maintenance of backend cloud infrastructure. Work cross-functionally with business teams. Collaborate with product to decompose requirements into technical tasks. Assist in writing algorithms to properly dispatch assets such as batteries based on energy market signals and predicted user energy demand. Unify data from building systems, sensors, APIs, and other sources; design and build a database solution for analyzing key performance indicators (KPIs) in the energy sector. Be cognizant of cost-of-service models to understand the financial cost of serving our customers, identify ways to drive efficiencies from our stack. Own engineering process to maximize velocity and code quality. Define the engineering organization, best practices, estimation, manage technical risk and debt, and own project management for the data/ML team. Recruit, mentor, inspire and develop engineering teams in New York. Set goals and manage the performance of the overall ML team ', 'Industry experience applying ML algorithms ', 'Oversee set up and maintenance of backend cloud infrastructure. ', 'Own engineering process to maximize velocity and code quality. Define the engineering organization, best practices, estimation, manage technical risk and debt, and own project management for the data/ML team. ', 'Our success will depend on aggregating and analyzing data to properly dispatch and manage users’ assets (such as battery storage, HVAC, and solar) in real-time energy markets to provide the customer with the most value possible. We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer who can spearhead the development of our data/ETL pipelines as well as some basic machine learning algorithms. ', '4+ years experience as a Data Engineer ', 'Strong Communication and Interpersonal skills ', 'As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be creating an energy management platform that is a first of its kind. The role reports to the CTO and will be located at our HQ in our Brooklyn, NY offices. ', 'Strong network in the NYC tech scene and ability to use relationships to recruit great talent ', 'Passion for designing and delivering mission critical code and products ', 'MS/PhD in Computer Science or Applied Math Strong network in the NYC tech scene and ability to use relationships to recruit great talent Familiar with or able to learn quickly about building systems and IoT sensors, their data, and analysis of it (HVAC, occupancy, temperature, energy meters, etc.) Accountability-minded. We are using software driven solutions to create an entirely new way of doing business in this space and build a category defining company. Our mission is to give energy customers greater transparency and control while creating a cheaper, cleaner, more reliable electricity grid. ', 'Unify data from building systems, sensors, APIs, and other sources; design and build a database solution for analyzing key performance indicators (KPIs) in the energy sector. ']

['', 'Practical experience with data modeling (e.g. dimensional modeling, temporal modeling, OLAP)', 'Basic Qualifications', "What you'll do:", 'Senior Data Engineer', 'Deep knowledge of at least one programming language ecosystem (e.g. Python, Scala, Go) ', 'What we’re looking for:', 'Preferred Qualifications', 'Keep reading if:', ' ', 'Deep knowledge of at least one programming language ecosystem (e.g. Python, Scala, Go) Practical experience with data modeling (e.g. dimensional modeling, temporal modeling, OLAP)', "At our company, we’re building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, our company is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.Senior Data EngineerCommercial Launchpad helps push the Commercial Bank forward by incubating new ideas and accelerating strategic initiatives. We are a diverse, balanced and fearless team of designers, product managers, data scientists, engineers & strategists — working together to solve complex problems across the Commercial Bank. We move fast, we have the freedom to take risks, both in the ways we approach problems and the tools we use.Keep reading if:You embrace change and innovation, always seeking to push the boundaries, are comfortable with challenging the status-quo, and thrive in ambiguity.You LOVE technology and learning new things.What we’re looking for:Amazing technical instincts. You know how to evaluate and choose the right technology and approach for the job. You have stories you could share about what problem you thought you were solving at first, but through testing and iteration, came to solve a much bigger and better problem that resulted in positive outcomes all-around.A love for learning. Technology is continually evolving around us, and you want to keep up to date to ensure we are using the right tech at the right time.Confidence, not ego. You have an ability to collaborate with others and see all sides of the coin to come to the best solution for everyone.Demonstrated experience in the open source, big data ecosystem.What you'll do:As the data engineering technical lead within Launchpad, you’ll be working collaboratively with some of our brightest engineering talent to solve challenging, high impact business problems using data. You will be evaluating, installing, configuring, and deploying software; you will be writing code and use thoughtful engineering practices to test it, deploy it, and run it. We are a part of a larger organization, so we will rely on your ability to get things done through others.All of our infrastructure runs on AWS. Currently we use Airflow, PySpark, NiFi, Kafka, Flink for stream processing. We store data in Parquet and use databases such as Cassandra, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Redshift and Snowflake. We do analytics using H2O, Spark and MLlib, Databricks/EMR, TensorFlow. We build awesome products for our users that use this data. We write microservices in Go and Node.js, orchestrated by Kubernetes, with user experiences written in React and TypeScript. Your hands-on expertise in at least some of these tools will be valuable, as well as your track record of providing effective technical guidance.Basic QualificationsAt least 3 years of experience in software engineering inclusive of source control, agile practices, testing, CI/CD and design principlesAt least 3 years data engineering experience that includes Ingestion, Transformation, Storage, Query, or Analytics open source toolsPreferred Qualifications"]

['', 'The ideal candidate will be a passionate and hands on leader who wants to build the foundations of a world class software organization. We want someone with an innate curiosity who would enjoy getting up to speed on energy quickly in order to approach this sector in a new way. ', ' Preferred Qualifications:', 'MS/PhD in Computer Science or Applied Math ', 'Accountability-minded. Can create a culture of healthy accountability in the team. Can balance code quality and speed to market. Been through a startup before', 'Senior Data/ML Engineer ', 'Participate in the design and implementation of all data science initiatives including ETL/data pipeline building and machine learning/forecasting systems. Build models and programs to predict building demand and onsite energy generation through analysis of data from building management system, weather, and other similar systems to aid in reducing energy consumption. Oversee set up and maintenance of backend cloud infrastructure. Work cross-functionally with business teams. Collaborate with product to decompose requirements into technical tasks. Assist in writing algorithms to properly dispatch assets such as batteries based on energy market signals and predicted user energy demand. Unify data from building systems, sensors, APIs, and other sources; design and build a database solution for analyzing key performance indicators (KPIs) in the energy sector. Be cognizant of cost-of-service models to understand the financial cost of serving our customers, identify ways to drive efficiencies from our stack. Own engineering process to maximize velocity and code quality. Define the engineering organization, best practices, estimation, manage technical risk and debt, and own project management for the data/ML team. Recruit, mentor, inspire and develop engineering teams in New York. Set goals and manage the performance of the overall ML team ', 'Industry experience applying ML algorithms ', 'Oversee set up and maintenance of backend cloud infrastructure. ', 'Own engineering process to maximize velocity and code quality. Define the engineering organization, best practices, estimation, manage technical risk and debt, and own project management for the data/ML team. ', 'Our success will depend on aggregating and analyzing data to properly dispatch and manage users’ assets (such as battery storage, HVAC, and solar) in real-time energy markets to provide the customer with the most value possible. We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer who can spearhead the development of our data/ETL pipelines as well as some basic machine learning algorithms. ', '4+ years experience as a Data Engineer ', 'Strong Communication and Interpersonal skills ', 'As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be creating an energy management platform that is a first of its kind. The role reports to the CTO and will be located at our HQ in our Brooklyn, NY offices. ', 'Strong network in the NYC tech scene and ability to use relationships to recruit great talent ', 'Passion for designing and delivering mission critical code and products ', 'MS/PhD in Computer Science or Applied Math Strong network in the NYC tech scene and ability to use relationships to recruit great talent Familiar with or able to learn quickly about building systems and IoT sensors, their data, and analysis of it (HVAC, occupancy, temperature, energy meters, etc.) Accountability-minded. Can create a culture of healthy accountability in the team. Can balance code quality and speed to market. Been through a startup before', 'Recruit, mentor, inspire and develop engineering teams in New York. Set goals and manage the performance of the overall ML team ', 'Senior Data/ML Engineer', 'Responsibilities include:', ' ', 'Our firm is creating a new kind of energy company. Traditional Retail Electricity Providers are outdated, opaque, and painful for customers to engage with. We are using software driven solutions to create an entirely new way of doing business in this space and build a category defining company. Our mission is to give energy customers greater transparency and control while creating a cheaper, cleaner, more reliable electricity grid. ', '4+ years experience as a Data Engineer Industry experience applying ML algorithms Strong Communication and Interpersonal skills Passion for designing and delivering mission critical code and products BS in Computer Science or Applied Math ', ' Minimum Qualifications:', 'Assist in writing algorithms to properly dispatch assets such as batteries based on energy market signals and predicted user energy demand. ', 'BS in Computer Science or Applied Math ', 'Build models and programs to predict building demand and onsite energy generation through analysis of data from building management system, weather, and other similar systems to aid in reducing energy consumption. ', 'Participate in the design and implementation of all data science initiatives including ETL/data pipeline building and machine learning/forecasting systems. ', 'Familiar with or able to learn quickly about building systems and IoT sensors, their data, and analysis of it (HVAC, occupancy, temperature, energy meters, etc.) ', 'Be cognizant of cost-of-service models to understand the financial cost of serving our customers, identify ways to drive efficiencies from our stack. ', 'Work cross-functionally with business teams. Collaborate with product to decompose requirements into technical tasks. ', 'Unify data from building systems, sensors, APIs, and other sources; design and build a database solution for analyzing key performance indicators (KPIs) in the energy sector. ']

['', 'The ideal candidate will be a passionate and hands on leader who wants to build the foundations of a world class software organization. We want someone with an innate curiosity who would enjoy getting up to speed on energy quickly in order to approach this sector in a new way. ', ' Preferred Qualifications:', 'MS/PhD in Computer Science or Applied Math ', 'Accountability-minded. Can create a culture of healthy accountability in the team. Can balance code quality and speed to market. Been through a startup before', 'Senior Data/ML Engineer ', 'Participate in the design and implementation of all data science initiatives including ETL/data pipeline building and machine learning/forecasting systems. Build models and programs to predict building demand and onsite energy generation through analysis of data from building management system, weather, and other similar systems to aid in reducing energy consumption. Oversee set up and maintenance of backend cloud infrastructure. Work cross-functionally with business teams. Collaborate with product to decompose requirements into technical tasks. Assist in writing algorithms to properly dispatch assets such as batteries based on energy market signals and predicted user energy demand. Unify data from building systems, sensors, APIs, and other sources; design and build a database solution for analyzing key performance indicators (KPIs) in the energy sector. Be cognizant of cost-of-service models to understand the financial cost of serving our customers, identify ways to drive efficiencies from our stack. Own engineering process to maximize velocity and code quality. Define the engineering organization, best practices, estimation, manage technical risk and debt, and own project management for the data/ML team. Recruit, mentor, inspire and develop engineering teams in New York. Set goals and manage the performance of the overall ML team ', 'Industry experience applying ML algorithms ', 'Oversee set up and maintenance of backend cloud infrastructure. ', 'Own engineering process to maximize velocity and code quality. Define the engineering organization, best practices, estimation, manage technical risk and debt, and own project management for the data/ML team. ', 'Our success will depend on aggregating and analyzing data to properly dispatch and manage users’ assets (such as battery storage, HVAC, and solar) in real-time energy markets to provide the customer with the most value possible. We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer who can spearhead the development of our data/ETL pipelines as well as some basic machine learning algorithms. ', '4+ years experience as a Data Engineer ', 'Strong Communication and Interpersonal skills ', 'As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be creating an energy management platform that is a first of its kind. The role reports to the CTO and will be located at our HQ in our Brooklyn, NY offices. ', 'Strong network in the NYC tech scene and ability to use relationships to recruit great talent ', 'Passion for designing and delivering mission critical code and products ', 'MS/PhD in Computer Science or Applied Math Strong network in the NYC tech scene and ability to use relationships to recruit great talent Familiar with or able to learn quickly about building systems and IoT sensors, their data, and analysis of it (HVAC, occupancy, temperature, energy meters, etc.) Accountability-minded. Can create a culture of healthy accountability in the team. Can balance code quality and speed to market. Been through a startup before', 'Recruit, mentor, inspire and develop engineering teams in New York. Set goals and manage the performance of the overall ML team ', 'Senior Data/ML Engineer', 'Responsibilities include:', ' ', 'Our firm is creating a new kind of energy company. Traditional Retail Electricity Providers are outdated, opaque, and painful for customers to engage with. We are using software driven solutions to create an entirely new way of doing business in this space and build a category defining company. Our mission is to give energy customers greater transparency and control while creating a cheaper, cleaner, more reliable electricity grid. ', '4+ years experience as a Data Engineer Industry experience applying ML algorithms Strong Communication and Interpersonal skills Passion for designing and delivering mission critical code and products BS in Computer Science or Applied Math ', ' Minimum Qualifications:', 'Assist in writing algorithms to properly dispatch assets such as batteries based on energy market signals and predicted user energy demand. ', 'BS in Computer Science or Applied Math ', 'Build models and programs to predict building demand and onsite energy generation through analysis of data from building management system, weather, and other similar systems to aid in reducing energy consumption. ', 'Participate in the design and implementation of all data science initiatives including ETL/data pipeline building and machine learning/forecasting systems. ', 'Familiar with or able to learn quickly about building systems and IoT sensors, their data, and analysis of it (HVAC, occupancy, temperature, energy meters, etc.) ', 'Be cognizant of cost-of-service models to understand the financial cost of serving our customers, identify ways to drive efficiencies from our stack. ', 'Work cross-functionally with business teams. Collaborate with product to decompose requirements into technical tasks. ', 'Unify data from building systems, sensors, APIs, and other sources; design and build a database solution for analyzing key performance indicators (KPIs) in the energy sector. ']

['', 'The ideal candidate will be a passionate and hands on leader who wants to build the foundations of a world class software organization. We want someone with an innate curiosity who would enjoy getting up to speed on energy quickly in order to approach this sector in a new way. ', ' Preferred Qualifications:', 'MS/PhD in Computer Science or Applied Math ', 'Accountability-minded. Can create a culture of healthy accountability in the team. Can balance code quality and speed to market. Been through a startup before', 'Senior Data/ML Engineer ', 'Participate in the design and implementation of all data science initiatives including ETL/data pipeline building and machine learning/forecasting systems. Build models and programs to predict building demand and onsite energy generation through analysis of data from building management system, weather, and other similar systems to aid in reducing energy consumption. Oversee set up and maintenance of backend cloud infrastructure. Work cross-functionally with business teams. Collaborate with product to decompose requirements into technical tasks. Assist in writing algorithms to properly dispatch assets such as batteries based on energy market signals and predicted user energy demand. Unify data from building systems, sensors, APIs, and other sources; design and build a database solution for analyzing key performance indicators (KPIs) in the energy sector. Be cognizant of cost-of-service models to understand the financial cost of serving our customers, identify ways to drive efficiencies from our stack. Own engineering process to maximize velocity and code quality. Define the engineering organization, best practices, estimation, manage technical risk and debt, and own project management for the data/ML team. Recruit, mentor, inspire and develop engineering teams in New York. Set goals and manage the performance of the overall ML team ', 'Industry experience applying ML algorithms ', 'Oversee set up and maintenance of backend cloud infrastructure. ', 'Own engineering process to maximize velocity and code quality. Define the engineering organization, best practices, estimation, manage technical risk and debt, and own project management for the data/ML team. ', 'Our success will depend on aggregating and analyzing data to properly dispatch and manage users’ assets (such as battery storage, HVAC, and solar) in real-time energy markets to provide the customer with the most value possible. We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer who can spearhead the development of our data/ETL pipelines as well as some basic machine learning algorithms. ', '4+ years experience as a Data Engineer ', 'Strong Communication and Interpersonal skills ', 'As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be creating an energy management platform that is a first of its kind. The role reports to the CTO and will be located at our HQ in our Brooklyn, NY offices. ', 'Strong network in the NYC tech scene and ability to use relationships to recruit great talent ', 'Passion for designing and delivering mission critical code and products ', 'MS/PhD in Computer Science or Applied Math Strong network in the NYC tech scene and ability to use relationships to recruit great talent Familiar with or able to learn quickly about building systems and IoT sensors, their data, and analysis of it (HVAC, occupancy, temperature, energy meters, etc.) Accountability-minded. Can create a culture of healthy accountability in the team. Can balance code quality and speed to market. Been through a startup before', 'Recruit, mentor, inspire and develop engineering teams in New York. Set goals and manage the performance of the overall ML team ', 'Senior Data/ML Engineer', 'Responsibilities include:', ' ', 'Our firm is creating a new kind of energy company. Traditional Retail Electricity Providers are outdated, opaque, and painful for customers to engage with. We are using software driven solutions to create an entirely new way of doing business in this space and build a category defining company. Our mission is to give energy customers greater transparency and control while creating a cheaper, cleaner, more reliable electricity grid. ', '4+ years experience as a Data Engineer Industry experience applying ML algorithms Strong Communication and Interpersonal skills Passion for designing and delivering mission critical code and products BS in Computer Science or Applied Math ', ' Minimum Qualifications:', 'Assist in writing algorithms to properly dispatch assets such as batteries based on energy market signals and predicted user energy demand. ', 'BS in Computer Science or Applied Math ', 'Build models and programs to predict building demand and onsite energy generation through analysis of data from building management system, weather, and other similar systems to aid in reducing energy consumption. ', 'Participate in the design and implementation of all data science initiatives including ETL/data pipeline building and machine learning/forecasting systems. ', 'Familiar with or able to learn quickly about building systems and IoT sensors, their data, and analysis of it (HVAC, occupancy, temperature, energy meters, etc.) ', 'Be cognizant of cost-of-service models to understand the financial cost of serving our customers, identify ways to drive efficiencies from our stack. ', 'Work cross-functionally with business teams. Collaborate with product to decompose requirements into technical tasks. ', 'Unify data from building systems, sensors, APIs, and other sources; design and build a database solution for analyzing key performance indicators (KPIs) in the energy sector. ']

C++14/17 is beneficial Experience with columnar time series databases such as KDB would be welcome Experience with distributed systems (Condor, Hadoop, Spark) in a Linux environment Experience with data warehousing, ETL processes, and database schema design Ability to troubleshoot any performance, system, or data-related issue Previous experience in the design, optimization, and support of big-data ecosystems Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with machine learning researchers, traders, and other engineers Have an interest and enthusiasm for learning about financial markets (previous experience not required) ", 'Free breakfast, lunch, and dinner ', 'Ping pong and poker games Team outings, such as go-karting and cooking classes Power stretching and floatation therapy Unlimited office snacks Free breakfast, lunch, and dinner Gym Membership Meditation', 'As a Data Engineer at our firm, you will play a critical role in managing vast amounts of data that drive our automated trading platform. You will be tasked with developing architectures that will help qualify, process, normalize, and integrate data into machine learning systems. \xa0You will be the advocate of all things data and its potential to drive our research and trading efforts. ', "Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field from a top tier university ", 'Team outings, such as go-karting and cooking classes ', 'Ability to troubleshoot any performance, system, or data-related issue ', 'Demonstrable experience with Python and SQL.  C++14/17 is beneficial ', 'Gym Membership ', 'DATA ENGINEER ', 'Unlimited office snacks ', 'You can expect: ', 'Experience with distributed systems (Condor, Hadoop, Spark) in a Linux environment ', 'Previous experience in the design, optimization, and support of big-data ecosystems ', 'Experience with columnar time series databases such as KDB would be welcome ', 'Power stretching and floatation therapy ', ' ', 'Have an interest and enthusiasm for learning about financial markets (previous experience not required) ', "The nature of the problems we work on are really challenging, hence we hire some of the world's top talent to develop novel AI methods and trading strategies. Our team of talented researchers and technologists have been recognized as leaders in their field. We are passionate about hiring the best and the brightest, empowering them with the tools and mentorship needed to be successful. Our environment is highly collaborative and open, fostering innovation and growth. ", 'NEW YORK ', "3+ years' experience in data engineering or related software engineering ", 'While we are serious about our work at our company, we also promote a fun startup environment!\xa0 ', 'Ping pong and poker games ']

['', 'Required:', 'Plusses:\uf0b7 Amazon Redshift\uf0b7 Hadoop\uf0b7 Prior experience as a front-end, back-end, or full-stack web developer\uf0b7 Javascript / NodeJS\uf0b7 Python Django/Flask', 'Who Are We?We are an investment firm based in New York, NY. Our data team creates products that play acritical role in our investment decisions. We leverage technology and advanced analyticalmethods to organize, analyze, evaluate and discover new insights. We work in a smallintegrated team. ', 'Who Are We?', 'Data Product Engineer', 'Required:\uf0b7 3+ Years professional experience with Python and Bash\uf0b7 Python data structures and best practices\uf0b7 Professional experience with a SQL-based database, such as MySQL\uf0b7 Writes organized code with appropriate exception handling and logging\uf0b7 Understanding of HTTP network requests and responses\uf0b7 Understanding of HTML, XML, and JSON formats\uf0b7 Debugging experience\uf0b7 Ability to write technical documentation and comment code\uf0b7 Ability to write test suites and set up automation environments\uf0b7 Bash scripting\uf0b7 AWS and Linux (Ubuntu/CentOS) ', 'What’s the Job?', 'What’s the Job?You’ll be joining our data science team as a Data Product Engineer. You’ll be responsible fortesting, monitoring, and improving the data collection programs we have in production, as wellas developing new software to capture data from the web and extract insights from third-partysources. You’ll be writing Python scripts deployed on AWS, and communicating with datascientists and infrastructure engineers. ']

C++14/17 is beneficial Experience with columnar time series databases such as KDB would be welcome Experience with distributed systems (Condor, Hadoop, Spark) in a Linux environment Experience with data warehousing, ETL processes, and database schema design Ability to troubleshoot any performance, system, or data-related issue Previous experience in the design, optimization, and support of big-data ecosystems Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with machine learning researchers, traders, and other engineers Have an interest and enthusiasm for learning about financial markets (previous experience not required) ", 'Free breakfast, lunch, and dinner ', 'Ping pong and poker games Team outings, such as go-karting and cooking classes Power stretching and floatation therapy Unlimited office snacks Free breakfast, lunch, and dinner Gym Membership Meditation', 'As a Data Engineer at our firm, you will play a critical role in managing vast amounts of data that drive our automated trading platform. You will be tasked with developing architectures that will help qualify, process, normalize, and integrate data into machine learning systems. \xa0You will be the advocate of all things data and its potential to drive our research and trading efforts. ', "Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field from a top tier university ", 'Team outings, such as go-karting and cooking classes ', 'Ability to troubleshoot any performance, system, or data-related issue ', 'Demonstrable experience with Python and SQL.  C++14/17 is beneficial ', 'Gym Membership ', 'DATA ENGINEER ', 'Unlimited office snacks ', 'You can expect: ', 'Experience with distributed systems (Condor, Hadoop, Spark) in a Linux environment ', 'Previous experience in the design, optimization, and support of big-data ecosystems ', 'Experience with columnar time series databases such as KDB would be welcome ', 'Power stretching and floatation therapy ', ' ', 'Have an interest and enthusiasm for learning about financial markets (previous experience not required) ', "The nature of the problems we work on are really challenging, hence we hire some of the world's top talent to develop novel AI methods and trading strategies. Our team of talented researchers and technologists have been recognized as leaders in their field. We are passionate about hiring the best and the brightest, empowering them with the tools and mentorship needed to be successful. Our environment is highly collaborative and open, fostering innovation and growth. ", 'NEW YORK ', "3+ years' experience in data engineering or related software engineering ", 'While we are serious about our work at our company, we also promote a fun startup environment!\xa0 ', 'Ping pong and poker games ']
